title: How Christianity Rewrites the Human Mind
description:
Get Today's Guide: https://wyndowshop.dldd.us/shopnow/index.php?rt=product/product&product_id=215

When people leave Christianity, they don‚Äôt just leave beliefs behind ‚Äî they leave behind a way of thinking, feeling, and interpreting reality.
That‚Äôs because Christianity doesn‚Äôt simply teach doctrines. It installs psychological, emotional, relational, and epistemological templates that quietly shape the human mind from childhood forward.

In this video, we explore how Christianity rewrites cognition itself ‚Äî not just what people believe, but how they evaluate goodness, love, self-worth, guilt, belonging, authority, and truth. These mental frameworks don‚Äôt disappear when faith fades. They follow people into adulthood, relationships, politics, parenting, and identity.

We break down six powerful templates Christianity installs:
‚Ä¢ Moral evaluation shaped by authority
‚Ä¢ Love fused with fear, sacrifice, and submission
‚Ä¢ Self-worth framed as defectiveness
‚Ä¢ Guilt and gratitude used as emotional control
‚Ä¢ Belonging conditioned on belief and compliance
‚Ä¢ Thinking trained around loyalty instead of evidence

If you grew up Christian and still struggle with boundaries, over-apologizing, guilt for thinking independently, fear of disagreement, or difficulty trusting your own mind ‚Äî you‚Äôre not broken. You‚Äôre responding exactly as you were trained.

This isn‚Äôt about attacking faith.
It‚Äôs about understanding what religion does to the human mind ‚Äî and how to reclaim your cognitive freedom after belief.

üìò Get the full accompanying study guide for deeper psychological and sociological breakdowns, language for what you‚Äôve experienced, and tools for interrupting these patterns:
üëâ Available now on WyndowShop: https://wyndowshop.dldd.us/shopnow/index.php?rt=product/product&product_id=215

Keep rising. Keep thinking. Keep choosing yourself.

title: The Hidden History of Christmas: From Saturn to Santa
description:
The Hidden History of Christmas: From Saturn to Santa

Christmas didn‚Äôt begin as a Christian holiday‚Äîand it certainly didn‚Äôt begin as Jesus‚Äô birthday.

In this deep historical breakdown, we trace the real origins of Christmas, from ancient Roman winter festivals like Saturnalia and Sol Invictus, through early Christianity‚Äôs struggle with delayed expectations, to the modern holiday shaped by Victorian morality, Santa Claus, and consumer culture.

This video explores:
Why the New Testament never gives a date for Jesus‚Äô birth
Why early Christians avoided birthdays altogether
How December 25 became symbolically powerful long before Christianity
How Christianity adapted pagan calendars instead of erasing them
Why medieval Christmas was chaotic‚Äînot family-friendly
Why Puritans tried to ban Christmas entirely
How the 19th century reinvented Christmas around family, children, and consumption
How Santa Claus evolved from ancient myths, folklore, and modern marketing

Why Christmas survives not because it‚Äôs fixed‚Äîbut because it evolves

This is not an attack on Christmas‚Äîand it‚Äôs not an attempt to take meaning away from it.
It‚Äôs an honest look at how traditions are built, adapted, resisted, and repurposed over time.

If you‚Äôve ever wondered where Christmas really comes from‚Äîor why it still matters even without belief‚Äîthis is the story.
Chapters
00:00 The True Origins of Christmas
00:39 Biblical and Early Christian Views on Birthdays
05:39 The Emergence of December 25th
13:45 Medieval and Early Modern Christmas
17:11 The Victorian Reinvention of Christmas
22:52 Santa Claus: A Cultural Composite
24:53 The Enduring Legacy of Christmas
27:44 Seasonal Greetings and Final Thoughts

title: How Christianity Trains You to Distrust Yourself
description:
How Christianity Trains You to Distrust Yourself examines how the teachings of Jesus and Paul reframe personal autonomy as a moral problem. This video explores how obedience replaces self-trust, why desire and independent judgment are treated as suspect, and how these ideas continue shaping people long after deconversion. We also unpack why reclaiming autonomy often feels sinful, why ex-Christians seek certainty and authority, and what it takes to rebuild agency after religion.

06:59 Paul's Teachings on Selfhood
09:52 The Consequences of Moral Dependence

title: What I Learned Going From Over 500 to Under 200 Pounds
description:
How did I go from 580 lbs to 180 lbs‚Äîand what did deconstruction have to do with it? This isn‚Äôt a ‚Äúdiet success story.‚Äù I‚Äôd been dieting since elementary school‚Äîpersonal trainers, church workouts, metabolism hacks‚Äînone of it worked because my weight wasn‚Äôt just a mistake‚Ä¶ it was a strategy.

In this video I break down how bodies can solve psychological and social problems we‚Äôve never named, why my weight was obedience to fear and expectations, and what changed in 2014 when I stopped believing in God and stopped outsourcing responsibility for my outcomes. I unpack the shift from living on reflex to living on response, why ‚Äúfixing the body‚Äù fails when the self is still imprisoned, and the simple framework that finally made sense for me: Wisdom, Water, and Walking.

If you‚Äôre intellectually free but still personally stuck, this is your reminder: make that intelligence mean something. And if you want a space to do that work with other people‚Äîwithout labels‚Äîjoin the BridgeCity Global Campus. title: Black Church Myth: Real History vs. Savior Institution #shorts
description: The Black church wasn't always a haven or center of activism, but it was often under white control. The REAL work happened elsewhere. Let's build future-ready secular spaces beyond old myths. #BlackHistory #Community #Secularism #SocialJustice

title: The Black Church Myth: Unpacking a Hidden History #shorts
description:
Full Video: https://youtu.be/ojlmc0eUpsY
The Black church‚Äîvisible symbol, tolerated by America. But was it a pillar of strength, or a convenient prop while the real work happened elsewhere? A hard look at history reveals a more complex truth. #BlackChurch #CivilRights #BlackHistory #SocialJustice

title: This Will Offend Some People‚Ä¶ But the Black Church Isn‚Äôt What You Think
description:
The Black Church is often celebrated as the pillar of the Black community‚Äîbut when you look at the historical record, the economic data, and the sociological realities, a very different story emerges. In this video, we break down the myth that the Black Church built and sustained Black America, and uncover what really powered our progress.

From the Civil Rights era to modern political organizing, from economic development to cultural identity, the truth is far more complex than the nostalgia we inherited. This conversation isn‚Äôt about disrespect‚Äîit‚Äôs about accountability, honesty, and the future of Black institutions beyond myth and symbolism.

If we‚Äôre going to build strong, effective communities in the 21st century, we need to separate fruit from folklore, impact from intention, and facts from the stories we were told.

In this video, we explore:

üîπ Why the Black Church‚Äôs influence is more symbolic than structural
üîπ How the Civil Rights era distorted our understanding of the church
üîπ Why most Black organizing didn‚Äôt happen in churches
üîπ How media and pastors helped manufacture the church‚Äôs public image
üîπ What Black secular and grassroots institutions accomplished instead
üîπ How the myth harms modern Black progress
üîπ Why new, secular, future-ready institutions are needed now

This is for Black deconstructors, allies, skeptics, historians, and anyone ready to rethink the narrative we grew up with.

If you value honest conversations about Black history, community-building, and secular humanism‚Äîthis one is for you.
Chapters
00:00 Introduction: The Myth of the Black Church
01:08 Historical Context and Civil Rights Era
02:16 Fragmentation Within the Black Church
03:26 Economic Realities and Misconceptions
08:02 The Church's Role in Political Organizing
12:23 The Harmful Effects of the Myth
13:57 Call to Action: Building New Institutions
16:42 Conclusion and Community Invitation

title: People Matter More Than Ideas: Build Community Now! #shorts
description: Atheism is more than a negative proposition‚Äîit's a call to action. Humans are reason enough to build community, imagine more, and protect each other. The question now: What do we build together? #Atheism #Secularism #Humanism #CommunityBuilding

title: Why New Atheism Fell Apart ‚Äî And What Comes Next
description:
Why did New Atheism fall apart?
What happened after the Four Horsemen faded, the debates died down, and the atheist movement became a battlefield of culture wars and online hostility?

In this video, I break down the full sociological story of how New Atheism rose, fractured, and ultimately collapsed ‚Äî and why two new factions emerged in its place: Western Conservatheism and American Trolltheism.

We‚Äôll explore:
How Harris, Dennett, Dawkins, and Hitchens unified atheist thought
How the movement expanded beyond the Horsemen into mass-media atheism
Why it couldn‚Äôt sustain diversity, community, or emotional needs
The rise of Conservatheism and its cultural-war identity
The rise of Trolltheism and its algorithm-driven antagonism
How trauma, identity politics, and platform incentives fractured the movement
The silent middle who still want community without cruelty
And most importantly: What comes next for humanistic, future-oriented atheism

Chapters
00:00 Introduction: The Decline of New Atheism
00:46 The Rise and Fall of New Atheism
03:44 Fragmentation and the Post-New Atheist Landscape
08:18 Western Conservatheism: A Cultural Reaction
13:28 American Trolltheism: Performance Over Philosophy
18:30 The Loss of Unified Leadership
23:56 The Silent Middle: A Call for Humanistic Atheism
28:43 Conclusion: Building a Humanistic Secular Future

title: Why People Are NOT Joining Atheist Organizations
description:
Why are so many people leaving religion but not joining atheist or humanist organizations? The answer has nothing to do with belief‚Äîand everything to do with cost, culture, community, and survival. In this video, I break down the real reasons secular organizations struggle to attract people, especially those who lose far more than a belief system when they step away from religion.
We‚Äôll examine cultural identity, economic and relational fallout, the Black Tax and Secular Tax, historical suppression of secular movements, the failure of atheist institutions to build community, and why critique without construction will never create a movement.
If you‚Äôre deconstructing, questioning, or trying to understand why atheism hasn‚Äôt become a stronger social force in the U.S., this conversation will give you the infrastructure-level clarity missing from mainstream atheist discourse.

Chapters
00:00 Introduction: The Rise of Religious Nones
00:22 Cultural Identity and the Cost of Secularism
01:03 Nine Reasons Atheists Avoid Secular Organizations
01:08 Christianity as Cultural Identity
01:39 Fear of Repercussions
04:01 Assimilation and Survival Strategies
08:51 Distrust of Non-Religious Institutions
16:03 Combative Messaging vs. Constructive Support
17:46 The Overwhelming Weight of Everyday Life

title: Thanksgiving Isn‚Äôt About Gratitude ‚Äî It‚Äôs About Myth-Making
description:
Thanksgiving isn‚Äôt just a holiday‚Äîit‚Äôs a national myth. A carefully crafted story that turns colonization, genocide, and land theft into a feel-good ritual of unity. In this video, we‚Äôre deconstructing Thanksgiving honestly: not to ruin it, but to free it from propaganda.

We explore how American leaders rewrote history after the Civil War, how textbooks sanitized colonization, and how holidays function as political technology to manufacture identity and erase contradictions. But instead of simply boycotting the day, this video challenges you to transform it‚Äîinto truth-telling, solidarity, community building, and revolutionary family healing.

Use the day not for mythology, but for meaning. Not for erasure, but for evolution.

title: God‚Äôs Plan Is the Biggest Lie You Were Ever Told
description:
Original Video Here: https://youtu.be/x-sXU_EtuN4
Religion teaches millions to shrink themselves, wait on signs, and surrender their power to ‚ÄúGod‚Äôs plan.‚Äù But what if that belief is the biggest lie you were ever told? As we close out the year and move through back-to-back holidays, I‚Äôm resharing one of my most powerful videos‚Äîa reminder that your life is yours to build, not something to outsource to the invisible.

In this video, we unpack how religious conditioning steals agency, kills ambition, creates guilt-based control, and convinces people to wait instead of act. If you‚Äôve ever been told to ‚Äútrust God‚Äôs timing,‚Äù this conversation will help you reclaim your confidence, your identity, and your future.

title: Deconversion Can Cost You Everything‚ÄîHere‚Äôs Why
description:
Deconversion can cost you everything. In a society where belief is assumed, atheism becomes a scarlet letter‚Äîand millions of people in faith-saturated professions are forced to hide who they are just to survive.

In this video, we explore how deconversion impacts pastors, musicians, teachers, therapists, coaches, childcare workers, politicians, sales professionals, and community workers‚Äîand how assumed belief functions as a quiet system of control in the workplace.

You‚Äôll learn:
‚Ä¢ Why so many careers require the performance of belief
‚Ä¢ How atheists face economic coercion, moral suspicion, and identity loss
‚Ä¢ The real cost of honesty in faith-dominated industries
‚Ä¢ The professions most harmed by ‚Äúassumed belief‚Äù culture
‚Ä¢ How deconversion can threaten your job, reputation, and stability
‚Ä¢ Why America still punishes secular identities
‚Ä¢ What we lose when people can‚Äôt be honest about their worldview
‚Ä¢ Why we need secular alternatives for professionals who deconvert
‚Ä¢ How BridgeCity Global and DLDD World Group are building those alternatives

This is more than a critique‚Äîit‚Äôs a blueprint for creating secular spaces, platforms, and economies where former believers can use their gifts without pretending to believe in a God they don‚Äôt.

If you‚Äôve ever hidden your atheism, struggled during deconstruction, or felt punished for your honesty‚Äîthis video is for you.

title: How Christianity Uses Coercive Control (Without Calling It That)
description:
How Christianity Uses Coercive Control (Without Calling It That)
Religion has a lot in common with intimate partner abuse. From songs of surrender to scriptures of subjugation, many churches create high-demand environments that quietly normalize coercive control‚Äîthen call it love, obedience, or ‚ÄúGod‚Äôs will.‚Äù

In this video, we unpack how Christianity (especially evangelicalism) uses coercive control without ever naming it:
surveillance culture (‚ÄúGod is always watching‚Äù)
fear-based narratives (hell, demons, backsliding)
identity replacement (‚Äúdie to self‚Äù)
social isolation (us vs. them)
the ‚ÄúGod‚Äôs-eye view‚Äù that puts pastors and leaders above question

We‚Äôll also talk about why it doesn‚Äôt feel like control when you‚Äôre inside it, how it rewires your sense of self, and why even atheist and secular spaces can fall into the same patterns of dogma, purity culture, and virtue signaling.

Finally, I‚Äôll walk through a humanist path forward: rebuilding autonomy, reclaiming your body, learning emotional literacy, strengthening critical thinking, and discovering your own self-authority.

If you‚Äôre deconstructing, exvangelical, spiritually burned out, or just trying to make sense of why your faith experience felt like control instead of care‚Äîthis one‚Äôs for you.

üë• Looking for community?
Join BridgeCity, our progressive, people-centric secular community: bridgecity.app

‚Äì Like, subscribe, and share

Until next time‚Äîkeep rising.

title: Can Atheists Be Spiritual‚Ä¶Let‚Äôs Talk About It
description:
Can atheists be spiritual? In this video, we‚Äôre going all in on that question. What does ‚Äúspiritual‚Äù even mean if you don‚Äôt believe in gods, souls, or the supernatural? Can a former pastor-turned-atheist still claim spirituality with a straight face? Let‚Äôs talk about it.

I‚Äôm framing spirituality without the magic. No metaphysics. No divine downloads. Just the deepest layers of human experience: awe, wonder, meaning, belonging, compassion, connection, and our sense of place in the cosmos. I‚Äôll walk through how spirituality can be understood as an emergent property of human awareness‚Äîbeginning with self-talk and expanding through our relationships, our communities, and the universe itself.

Along the way, we‚Äôll pull from Carl Sagan (cosmic awe without gods), Daniel Dennett (self-talk and the narrative self), √âmile Durkheim (collective identity and the ‚Äúsacred‚Äù), and the African philosophy of Ubuntu (‚ÄúI am because we are‚Äù) to build a full model of secular spirituality that belongs to everyone‚Äîatheists included.

If this conversation hits home, let me know in the comments if you‚Äôd tap into a 4-part course on Secular Spirituality. And if you‚Äôre curious about BridgeCity, our global secular community, keep an eye out for our upcoming Open House week starting November 30th.

If you vibe with the content, the community, or the creator, don‚Äôt forget to like, share, subscribe, and consider supporting via the links in the description. Until next time‚Äîkeep rising.

title: The Myth of the Soul: How Religion Rewired Your Identity
description:
What if the ‚Äúsoul‚Äù you were taught to protect at all costs‚Ä¶ was never what you thought it was? In this conversation, I‚Äôm unpacking how the Christian concept of the soul didn‚Äôt just ‚Äúcomfort‚Äù people‚Äîit rewired our identity, our ethics, and even how we experience ourselves.

We‚Äôll trace where the idea of an immortal soul actually came from (Egypt, Greece, and philosophy long before Christianity), how the church fused Hebrew nephesh with Greek dualism, and how that merger created one of the most powerful control systems in human history. From eternal rewards and punishments to chronic self-surveillance and church authority as ‚Äúgatekeepers of the afterlife,‚Äù we‚Äôll look at how the soul became a tool for social compliance.

Then we‚Äôll zoom out and ask: What are mind, spirit, and soul‚Äîreally?
From neuroscience to secular philosophy, we‚Äôll explore how personality, memory, morality, and meaning can all be explained without a detachable ghost hiding inside your body. Instead of ‚Äúsaving your soul,‚Äù we‚Äôll talk about reclaiming your identity, agency, and purpose in this one wild, finite life.

If you‚Äôre deconstructing, deconverting, or just rethinking what you were taught about eternity, heaven, hell, and ‚Äúwho you really are,‚Äù this one is for you.

title: Is Atheism A Religion
description:
Crash Course: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CZXFZAxX3UA

Is atheism a religion? In this talk, I break it down with clear definitions and real-world examples. We‚Äôll separate belief from religion, show why atheism is simply a position on one question (not a system of worship), and unpack how people confuse atheism with humanism. We‚Äôll also look at New Atheism, why ‚Äúscience is a religion‚Äù misses the mark, and how religious humanism is recognized in the U.S.‚Äîincluding humanist churches, assemblies, and clubs where the central question is the human experience, not theism. Finally, we explore how atheism and open theism became gateways to seeing religion as a human invention‚Äîand why Humanism is the Bigger Gospel: cooperation, compassion, evidence, and shared progress.

title: Why Religion Wins and Secularism Burns Out
description:
Why does religion keep winning while secularism keeps burning out?

In this episode, Darante‚Äô LaMar unpacks the Spiritual-Industrial Complex ‚Äî the network of institutions, media, and political systems that have turned faith into a self-funding industry. From Cold War propaganda to modern Christian nationalism and influencer marketing, religion has learned how to build machines of meaning ‚Äî while secularism keeps trying to fight with passion alone.

Discover why truth without systems keeps losing to myth with machinery, how the ‚ÄúBible in the Schools‚Äù movement really follows the money, and why secular voices are being softened by algorithms, economics, and ego.

Darante‚Äô LaMar breaks down:
How religion industrialized spirituality
How faith became a political and economic engine
How secularism can evolve from reaction to system-building
The lesson of John Henry ‚Äî and why heart alone can‚Äôt beat the machine

title: The Bible Is The Ultimate Fan Fiction (Part 2)
description:
What if the Bible reads less like sacred history and more like‚Ä¶ fan fiction?
In Part 2, we dig into expanded-universe crossovers, fan-service for insiders, author self-inserts, conflicting timelines, and the endless sequels that keep the myth alive. From Gilgamesh echoes to New Testament retcons, we unpack how power, propaganda, and storytelling shaped a ‚Äúshared cinematic universe‚Äù long before Marvel.

Chapters below. If this made you think, like, subscribe, and share it with someone wrestling with faith, history, or how stories shape power.

title: The Problem with Jesus‚Äô Parables
description:

What if the beloved parables of Jesus aren‚Äôt teaching what we think they are?

In this episode, former pastor Darante‚Äô LaMar takes a humanist look at the parables‚ÄîTen Virgins, Talents, Sheep & Goats, Prodigal Son, Rich Man & Lazarus‚Äîand asks whether they reward obedience over ethics, hierarchy over dignity, and fear over compassion. If you‚Äôre deconstructing or just curious, this is a thoughtful, data-driven critique‚Äînot a hot take.

title: How Hell Exposes the Incompetence of God
description:
ENJOY HIS THROWBACK: Original Video Here: https://youtu.be/W-mQwkFBgaY

Taking a breather after our Lift/Off WKND, I‚Äôm republishing one of my most talked-about breakdowns ‚Äî 

What does the idea of hell really say about the god who created it?
If God is supposedly perfect, all-knowing, and all-powerful, then the very existence of hell raises one uncomfortable question: how competent is this deity, really?

In this episode, former pastor Darante‚Äô LaMar breaks down why hell is a theological contradiction, not a moral necessity. From childhood sermons about screams beneath the earth to the shifting stories of heaven and hell‚Äôs ‚Äúlocations,‚Äù this conversation challenges the logic, justice, and ethics behind eternal punishment.

We‚Äôll unpack:
üî• The moving target of heaven and hell‚Äôs ‚Äúlocations‚Äù
‚öñÔ∏è Why hell implies divine failure, not justice
üß© The psychological roots of fear-based belief systems
üí≠ How cultural hells (Greek, Egyptian, Christian) are all the same story ‚Äî fear in disguise
üåç And why freeing yourself from hell-fear means reclaiming your life in reality

If you‚Äôve ever wrestled with the question, ‚ÄúWhat if I‚Äôm wrong?‚Äù ‚Äî this is for you.
Hell doesn‚Äôt prove God‚Äôs justice. It exposes the cracks in the entire belief system.

title: The Case for Jesus: History, Myth, or Meaningless?
description:
ENJOY HIS THROWBACK: Original Video Here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C7L-mP24uGs&t=322s

Was Jesus of Nazareth a real historical figure ‚Äî or just a myth that got out of hand? In this episode, Darante‚Äô LaMar breaks down the three major positions in the ‚ÄúDid Jesus Exist?‚Äù debate: the Historicist, the Mythicist, and a lesser-known third stance ‚Äî the Apathist (or Jesus Atheist).

We‚Äôll look at the arguments of historians like Bart Ehrman, the questionable reliability of Josephus and Tacitus, and why the obsession with proving Jesus existed might actually be meaningless.

If miracles are myths and ‚Äúfaith‚Äù is just fiction, does it even matter if Jesus was real? Let‚Äôs talk about it.

üëÅÔ∏è‚Äçüó®Ô∏è Topics covered:

Why historical ‚Äúevidence‚Äù for Jesus is weaker than claimed
The problems with Josephus and Tacitus as sources
Why ‚Äúconsensus‚Äù isn‚Äôt the same as proof
What it means to be a Jesus Apathist
Why modern secular humanists should move past the myth

Join today's conversation from Los Angeles, where we discuss how the Bible can be seen as fan fiction. Reflecting on nearly two decades in Christian ministry, today's video dives into understanding the Bible through a different lens‚Äîviewing it as literature built on older myths and narratives. This episode covers topics like the Bible‚Äôs origins in pre-existing myths, competing authorships, and collaborative storytelling, all while sharing personal insights and challenges faced by believers. In this episode, Darante‚Äô LaMar unpacks the psychology of belief: how faith begins long before scripture, how indoctrination replaces investigation, and why the Bible functions more like a relic than a revelation.

title: Heaven Is a Place for Sociopaths
description:
REGISTER FOR CALIFORNIA HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/liftoff-wknd-tickets-1663973763319?aff=oddtdtcreator

What kind of people would celebrate after a bloodbath ‚Äî and call it holy?

In this episode, I unpack one of the most disturbing moral contradictions in Christian theology: the idea that heaven is a place of eternal joy built on eternal suffering.

If eternal bliss requires blindness to eternal pain, then heaven isn‚Äôt a reward for goodness ‚Äî it‚Äôs a test of empathy most believers fail beautifully.

Together we‚Äôll explore:
Why Christianity‚Äôs vision of victory looks more like vengeance than love.
How heaven trains believers to detach from compassion.
And why humanity‚Äôs real work isn‚Äôt getting into heaven‚Ä¶ but healing from it.

title: Why Christianity Needs Superstition
description:
REGISTER FOR CALIFORNIA HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/liftoff-wknd-tickets-1663973763319?aff=oddtdtcreator

Why does a religion that claims to be anchored in truth rely so heavily on superstition? From the boogeyman and demons in the shadows to Santa Claus and the Tooth Fairy, Christian homes often raise children in a world where fear and fantasy are treated as reality. In this video, we unpack how superstition acts as cultural scaffolding for faith, why Christian households normalize it, and what it means for imagination, innovation, and truth. If Christianity is about truth, why does it need so many myths to survive?

title: Where The Apostles Were Buried - Faith, Fact or Fiction
description:
REGISTER FOR CALIFORNIA HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/liftoff-wknd-tickets-1663973763319?aff=oddtdtcreator

Where were the apostles really buried? From St. Peter‚Äôs Basilica in Rome to Santiago de Compostela in Spain, traditions point to shrines, relics, and cathedrals across the world. But how much of it is history‚Äîand how much is legend? In this video, we trace the claimed tombs of all 12 apostles (and Paul), explore what archaeology and early writings reveal, and ask the critical question: are these final resting places faith, fact, or fiction?

In this video, I share 15 secular habits to replace prayer ‚Äî practical tools for finding peace, gratitude, courage, connection, and action without outsourcing your power to the divine.

Whether you‚Äôre newly deconstructing or you‚Äôve been nonreligious for years, this is about reclaiming your agency and learning to center yourself, reflect with gratitude, find strength, connect with others, and take real action in the world.

description:

Critical thinking is disappearing ‚Äî not because people are incapable, but because our systems reward speed, outrage, and conformity over depth, clarity, and courage. From information overload and algorithmic manipulation to groupthink and the tyranny of the majority, we are being conditioned to react instead of reflect. In this video, Darante‚Äô LaMar unpacks why this is happening, who benefits when we stop thinking for ourselves, and most importantly, how to reclaim your mind in a culture designed to keep us comfortably numb.

If you‚Äôve ever felt lost in the noise, anxious from the flood of information, or frustrated with shallow debates, this conversation offers a way back ‚Äî toward clarity, independence, and wisdom.

Stay curious. Stay awake. Keep thinking.

title: Faith vs. Science: Different Realms‚Ä¶ or a Rigged Game?
description:
REGISTER FOR CALIFORNIA HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/liftoff-wknd-tickets-1663973763319?aff=oddtdtcreator

Is faith really ‚Äújust as valid‚Äù as science, but in a different realm? That claim has been used for generations to protect religion from scrutiny ‚Äî but when we dig deeper, it falls apart. In this video, I break down why persistence doesn‚Äôt equal truth, how social sciences reveal the real reasons religion survives, and why faith works more like counterfeit currency than a legitimate system of knowledge.

We‚Äôll test faith against its own promises ‚Äî protection, justice, safety ‚Äî and see why it consistently bounces when the bill comes due. Faith isn‚Äôt the yen to science‚Äôs dollar; it‚Äôs monopoly money: colorful, persistent, but worthless when you try to spend it.

If you‚Äôre deconstructing religion, questioning old ideas, or simply curious about how belief systems survive without proving themselves, this conversation will give you clarity, tools, and maybe even some courage to keep asking real questions.

title: The Real Reason Religions Spread (It‚Äôs Not Theology)
description:
Learn more about humanism with the American Humanist Association: https://humanist.org/darantelamar

REGISTER FOR CALIFORNIA HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/liftoff-wknd-tickets-1663973763319?aff=oddtdtcreator

Why do religions spread? It‚Äôs not just about theology or belief in sacred texts. The real driver is sociology‚Äîthe hidden forces of community, culture, and social structures that shape how religions rise, grow, and decline.

In this video, Darante‚Äô LaMar breaks down the sociological effect: the way belonging, networks, institutions, and cultural resonance determine whether a religion thrives or fades. From early Christianity in the Roman Empire, to Islam‚Äôs rise in Arabia, to modern megachurches in the United States, we‚Äôll explore how religions succeed not because of doctrine, but because of the social conditions around them.

We‚Äôll also unpack how extremist movements use these same sociological forces‚Äîand how secular humanism can counter extremism by offering healthier forms of belonging, community, and meaning.

üëâ If you‚Äôre curious about sociology, religion, history, and humanism, this video is for you.
üëâ Watch to the end for my personal challenge and ways to get involved in building communities rooted in empathy, reason, and progress.

title: Are You In a Cult and Don‚Äôt Even Know It?
description:
Are you in a cult and don‚Äôt even know it? Cults aren‚Äôt just strange fringe groups or religious sects‚Äîthey can show up in churches, politics, corporations, self-help programs, and even personal relationships.

In this video, I break down the three core levers of cult control‚Äîcoercive control, enforced conformity, and dependency‚Äîand show you how to recognize them in everyday life. You‚Äôll learn how to spot the red flags of cult dynamics (authoritarian leaders, absolute truth claims, emotional manipulation, and exploitation) and discover practical ways to safeguard yourself from cultish ideology.

This is more than an expose. It‚Äôs a call to freedom. Healthy communities give you room to think, choose, and grow‚Äîcults demand you conform, obey, and surrender. If you‚Äôve ever wondered whether the group you‚Äôre part of is healthy or harmful, this video will give you the language, the framework, and the confidence to decide for yourself.

title: Christianity Runs on Fear, Not Love
description:
REGISTER FOR CALIFORNIA HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/liftoff-wknd-tickets-1663973763319?aff=oddtdtcreator

Christianity Runs on Fear, Not Love
Are Christians really living free‚Äîor living under duress?

In this Sunday Session, I unpack the ways Christianity functions like Stockholm Syndrome: keeping believers loyal through threats of hell, constant surveillance, and fear-driven invitations. When faith is rooted in coercion instead of love, what does that mean for those trapped inside‚Äîand for those of us trying to help?

You‚Äôll discover:
Why fear of eternal damnation is more psychological trap than spiritual truth
How ‚ÄúGod is watching‚Äù creates guilt, anxiety, and self-surveillance
Why church invitations are often coercion disguised as care
The proper response when someone pressures you with fear-driven faith
How to actually help Christians break free‚Äîfrom safe exits to joy beyond fear

This isn‚Äôt about attacking believers. It‚Äôs about naming coercion, exposing spiritual blackmail, and offering a path to human flourishing.

title: When Science Destroyed the Bible
description:
When Science Destroyed the Bible
Get Today's Guide: https://wyndowshop.dldd.us/shopnow/index.php?rt=product/product&product_id=212

When Science Destroyed the Bible takes you on a journey through the collapse of the Bible‚Äôs worldview in light of modern discovery. For centuries, the Bible claimed to map the universe: a young earth, a handcrafted human, a single founding couple, divine beings above, and heaven and hell layered into a flat-earth cosmos. But geology, genetics, evolution, mythology, and cosmology each revealed a bigger, truer picture‚Äîuntil the Bible‚Äôs framework became too small to contain reality.

In this video, we‚Äôll explore:
Why the young earth model collapsed under geology and astrophysics
How the mud and rib model of human origins fell apart in the face of evolution
Why the Adam & Eve myth crumbles under population genetics
How Yahweh and angels were borrowed from older mythologies
Why heaven and hell cannot survive modern cosmology
This isn‚Äôt about attacking faith‚Äîit‚Äôs about showing how science expanded our horizons and rendered the Bible‚Äôs categories obsolete.

title: Is Love Thy Neighbor‚Ä¶ Actually Loving?
description:
Is Love Thy Neighbor‚Ä¶ Actually Loving?
Get Today's Guide: https://wyndowshop.dldd.us/shopnow/index.php?rt=product/product&product_id=211

‚ÄúLove thy neighbor as thyself.‚Äù It‚Äôs one of the most quoted lines in the Bible, often used to claim that Christianity teaches universal love. But what if that‚Äôs not what the text actually says?

In this video, I dig deep into the Bible‚Äôs own words to uncover the real meaning of neighbor in Leviticus, Jesus‚Äô shocking disqualifiers about who counts as family, and John‚Äôs command to not love the world. What emerges is not a story of unconditional love for all humanity, but a pattern of bounded, exclusionary love reserved for insiders ‚Äî whether defined by ethnicity, obedience, or belief.

We‚Äôll also look at why figures like Carlton Pearson, who dared to preach universal love, were branded heretics and cast out. Because when you really trace the tradition, the Bible‚Äôs ethic of love has always drawn sharp lines ‚Äî insiders vs. outsiders, believers vs. unbelievers, covenant members vs. strangers.

üëâ If you‚Äôve ever wondered whether ‚ÄúLove Thy Neighbor‚Äù is actually loving ‚Äî or if it‚Äôs loyalty disguised as love ‚Äî this conversation will challenge everything you‚Äôve been told.

title: Christianity's Takeover: How Logic Changed Forever #shorts
description: Christianity didn't just rewrite history‚Äîit rewrote logic itself. By seizing the word logos, Christianity pulled reason out of the public square and locked it inside revelation. Reclaiming logos today might be one of the most radical acts of liberation we can imagine. #Christianity #logic #logos #philosophy #religion

title: How Christianity Hijacked Logic: From Reason to Religion
description:
How Christianity Hijacked Logic: From Reason to Religion

How did Christianity hijack logic and turn philosophy into theology?
Before the church ever quoted scripture, the word logos meant something very different. To the Greeks, it was the principle of reason, the hidden rhythm of the cosmos, the spark that allowed humans to rise above instinct and understand the world. Heraclitus, the Stoics, Plato, and Aristotle all saw logos as universal and accessible‚Äîlogic itself.

But then the Gospel of John declared: ‚ÄúIn the beginning was the Logos, and the Logos was with God, and the Logos was God.‚Äù In that single move, logos was no longer a shared tool of reason‚Äîit became Christ, the Word of God. What had once been democratic and testable was now exclusive and faith-based.

This video explores:
The Pre-Christian meaning of Logos in Greek philosophy.
How the Gospel of John rebranded reason into revelation.
The consequences of replacing inquiry with dogma.
How Augustine, Aquinas, and the Reformers doubled down to keep logic under theology.
Why reclaiming Logos today is a radical act of liberation.
üëâ If you‚Äôre deconstructing religion, exploring secular humanism, or asking hard questions about Christianity and reason, this is for you.

Timestamps:

01:23 The Original Meaning of Logos

title: Worship Isn‚Äôt Magic ‚Äî It‚Äôs Mechanics
description:
Worship Isn‚Äôt Magic ‚Äî It‚Äôs Mechanics

Why do the chills arrive right when the lights bloom and the bridge hits? Because worship ‚Äúatmosphere‚Äù is architecture for your nervous system. In Worship Isn‚Äôt Magic ‚Äî It‚Äôs Mechanics, I break down how sound design, lighting and space, call-and-response rituals, and even late nights/fasting combine to create the worship high‚Äîso you can enjoy the moment without handing over your steering wheel. No cynicism‚Äîjust agency.

What you‚Äôll learn
How chord progressions, sub-bass, pads, and build‚Üírelease structures move emotion
Why dim‚Üíbloom lighting, haze, and stage height shape awe and authority
Micro-rituals that intensify suggestibility (‚ÄúIf you feel Him, lift your hands‚Ä¶‚Äù)
Body factors that amplify arousal (sleep loss, fasting, breath patterns, movement)
‚ÄúFeeling ‚â† proof‚Äù: cognitive traps and the testimony economy
Simple guardrails to keep the beauty and lose the blur
Key ideas: engineered presence, worship psychology, group dynamics, consent & ethics, harm-reduction for high-arousal services.
Bottom line: Emotion is welcome. Agency is required.

In this video, a former pastor unpacks the Revival Effect‚Äîhow sound, lights, ritual, and group dynamics can create peak states that feel like ‚ÄúGod showed up.‚Äù We map the worship high, prayer confidence, authority surge, and revival absorption, then show how rooms are tuned to move your nervous system (no shame, just agency). Learn the cues‚Äîchord progressions, call-and-response, sub-bass, lighting blooms, late nights/fasting‚Äîand how to enjoy the moment without handing over your steering wheel. We‚Äôll also touch on cognitive traps (‚Äúfelt real‚Äù ‚â† ‚Äútherefore true‚Äù), testimony dynamics, and simple guardrails to keep the beauty and lose the blur.

What you‚Äôll learn
How revival environments engineer emotion (sound, light, micro-rituals)
Why worship can feel like MDMA-ish warmth + runner‚Äôs high
How ‚Äúprayer cadence + posture + expectancy‚Äù creates confidence chemistry
Why authority + applause lowers inhibition and inflates certainty

title: The Bible Didn‚Äôt Predict Everything ‚Äî It Predicted Nothing
description:
The Bible Didn‚Äôt Predict Everything ‚Äî It Predicted Nothing.

Christians often claim the Bible proves itself through prophecy ‚Äî history, kingdoms, Jesus, even the end of the world supposedly written thousands of years in advance. But is that really true?

In this video, Darante‚Äô LaMar unpacks the illusion of biblical prophecy, showing why so-called predictions fall into six categories: written after the fact, vague poetry, conditional warnings, flat-out failures, misquotes taken out of context, and self-fulfilling events. From Daniel‚Äôs ‚Äúpredictions‚Äù to Jesus‚Äô failed timelines, you‚Äôll see how prophecy has been spun into proof when it‚Äôs really just human storytelling.

We‚Äôll also explore the psychological and sociological reasons prophecy still holds power ‚Äî why people crave certainty, how leaders use prophecy to control, and why vague words feel convincing. By the end, you‚Äôll see why prophecy isn‚Äôt evidence of divine foresight ‚Äî it‚Äôs propaganda with poetic flair.

If you‚Äôve ever been told ‚ÄúThe Bible predicted everything,‚Äù this video will help you see why it predicted nothing.

title: The Bible Is a Love Letter? No‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs a Threat
description:
The Bible Is a Love Letter? No‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs a Threat
TAP IN: https://www.bridge.dldd.us/bcwknds/tapin.php

Christians often call the Bible ‚ÄúGod‚Äôs love letter to you.‚Äù But if you actually read it, much of it looks less like romance and more like a threat. What kind of love letter comes with war commands, purity codes, and eternal fire if you don‚Äôt ‚Äúlove back‚Äù?

In this video, we unpack the ‚ÄúBible as love letter‚Äù metaphor ‚Äî where it came from, why it works psychologically, and why it falls apart under real scrutiny. From Hosea‚Äôs jealous lover imagery to modern devotionals like The Father‚Äôs Love Letter, we‚Äôll look at how selective readings create comfort while hiding coercion.

Here‚Äôs what we‚Äôll cover:
Why Christians frame the Bible as a love letter
How verses like John 3:16, Hosea, and Song of Solomon get romanticized
The psychological pull of ‚ÄúDear You‚Äù devotionals
Why this metaphor ignores violence, laws, and coercion in scripture
The deeper problem: love without consent is control, not intimacy

By the end, we‚Äôll explore a new possibility: maybe the most important love letter isn‚Äôt an ancient anthology demanding obedience ‚Äî but the one we dare to write ourselves, to our communities and our future.

If you‚Äôre navigating faith, deconstruction, or just curious about Christian claims vs. reality, this conversation is for you.

title: My Biggest Problem With Religious Claims (5 Most Common Examples)
description:
My Biggest Problem With Religious Claims (5 Most Common Examples)
Get Today's Guide: https://wyndowshop.dldd.us/shopnow/index.php?rt=product/product&product_id=207

In this video, we examine five prevalent religious claims and the disingenuousness that often accompanies them. Darante‚Äô LaMar argues that many religious assertions are made with conviction but lack genuine evidence and understanding. Key topics include the misuse of the word 'know' in religious contexts, the universe requiring a creator, the idea that only God performs certain actions, divine healing, and the belief that God controls everyday functions like waking up and breathing. The episode encourages viewers to critically analyze these claims and underscores the importance of evidence-based knowledge over faith-based certainty. It also discusses the broader implications of accepting unverified beliefs in various aspects of life and society.

title: What Do Near Death Experiences PROVE? It‚Äôs Not What You Thought!
description:
What Do Near Death Experiences PROVE? It‚Äôs Not What You Thought!
Get The Guide: https://wyndowshop.dldd.us/shopnow/index.php?rt=product/product&product_id=205

In this episode, we explore the profound yet often misunderstood phenomenon of near-death experiences (NDEs). We delve into why NDEs, despite being emotionally powerful, do not serve as irrefutable evidence of a deity or afterlife. The discussion covers the scientific and philosophical criteria that must be met to qualify as evidence for God or an afterlife, none of which NDEs fulfill. We examine the role of the brain under extreme stress, neurochemical storms, and cross-cultural variations in NDEs. This episode aims to differentiate emotional experience from epistemological rigor, urging viewers to embrace inquiry over supernatural explanations.

title: The Smartest Man Alive Believes in Jesus ‚Äî Should You?
description:
The Smartest Man Alive Believes in Jesus ‚Äî Should You?

In June 2025, YoungHoon Kim, a South Korean scientist with the highest recorded IQ of 276, declared his belief in Jesus Christ, sparking widespread online discussion. This episode explores the implications of his statement, questioning the validity of using intelligence as an appeal to authority in matters of faith. It delves into the nature of intelligence, highlighting the difference between IQ and expertise across various fields. The discussion emphasizes the importance of critical thinking, epistemic humility, and the dangers of intellectual outsourcing. The host also introduces the concept of 'compartmentalization' and explores how even the most brilliant minds can hold contradictory beliefs. Ultimately, the episode encourages viewers to seek truth through evidence and personal inquiry rather than relying on the beliefs of reputedly smart individuals.

00:00 The Smartest Man Declares Faith

title: Why I Say With Certainty: There. Is. No. God.
description:
Why I Say With Certainty: There. Is. No. God.

In this thought-provoking video, Darante' LaMar strongly asserts that the concept of God is not a timeless, neutral proposition but a cultural adaptation rooted in human imagination. He argues that every known God concept has sociocultural origins tied to survival needs, ignorance, and social control. Dante critiques the tendency to entertain increasingly vague definitions of God, dismissing them as rhetorical decoys. He emphasizes that concrete historical and scientific scrutiny debunks traditional God claims and that undefined, abstract gods lack the attributes to be seriously considered. Ultimately, he concludes that God is an illusion sustained by human traditions, rituals, and collective psychology. Dante encourages viewers to reconsider the need to redefine and reinterpret the God concept and to focus on the tangible connections and emotions that truly ground our experiences.

06:50 The Historical and Cultural Context of God

11:08 The Emotional Gravity of God
13:03 The Human Experience Misinterpreted
14:59 Conclusion and Community Building

title: Faith Needs a Lie? Why Christians Still Defend the Shroud
description:
Faith Needs a Lie? Why Christians Still Defend the Shroud
Get the Guide Here: https://wyndowshop.dldd.us/shopnow/index.php?rt=product/product&product_id=198

In this episode, we critically examine the Shroud of Turin, a medieval relic believed by many to be the burial cloth of Jesus. Despite scientific evidence pointing to it being a 14th-century forgery, many Christians continue to venerate it. We explore the psychological, sociological, and theological reasons behind this persistent belief, questioning why faith communities often embrace forgeries and fabrications. The discussion extends to broader themes such as Christian nationalism, megachurch theatrics, and the economics of modern miracle claims, highlighting how symbolic obedience often trumps critical engagement in religious contexts.

üìú How Eusebius and later historians wove a continuous ‚Äúsuffering myth‚Äù
üêü Why ‚Äúdying for a belief‚Äù isn‚Äôt proof of its truth (the red-herring fallacy)
üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è The hidden debates over the historicity of Polycarp and other martyr acts

In this episode, we delve into the concept of prophecy, examining its roots and the cognitive biases that lead people to believe in prophets. We explore why prophecy appeals to millions, from patternicity to confirmation bias, and how prophecies' vague nature allows for retrospective reinterpretation. Through historical and contemporary case studies, we highlight the fallacies that keep these beliefs alive. We also discuss the inherent conflict between prophecy and free will, and how belief in hidden knowledge can lead to intellectual laziness. The episode encourages viewers to reclaim active knowledge-building and offers strategies for meaningful inquiry and lifelong learning.

title: When Did the Bible Become The Word of God
description:
When Did the Bible Become The Word of God
Get The Guide Here: https://wyndowshop.dldd.us/shopnow/index.php?rt=product/product&product_id=191

What if everything you've been told about the Bible's Divine authority was decided long after its pages were written? In this conversation, we unpack how the Bible became regarded as the word of God. Examining early councils, the Reformation, and modern interpretations, we explore the historical and social dynamics that led to its status as an infallible text. We discuss the formation of the biblical canon, the concept of inerrancy, and the social and psychological factors that perpetuate the belief in a perfect Bible. Join us as we challenge common assumptions and seek to understand the true origins of this sacred text.

title: The Truth Your Pastor Doesn‚Äôt Want You to Know About The Gospel
description:
The Truth Your Pastor Doesn‚Äôt Want You to Know About The Gospel
Get The Guide Here: https://wyndowshop.dldd.us/shopnow/index.php?rt=product/product&product_id=190

In this thought-provoking video, we delve into a critical examination of the New Testament gospels, questioning the long-standing belief that they were written by direct eyewitnesses. The discussion highlights the anonymous nature of the gospels, their late composition, and the dubious process of attributing them to apostles centuries later. The video also tackles issues surrounding Paul's historicity and the allegorical interpretations by early church fathers, suggesting that the New Testament may be more of a mythic creation than a factual historical account.

description:
What if the real danger wasn‚Äôt believing in God‚Äîbut believing you‚Äôre nothing without one? This episode explores the idea that belief in God isn't the central issue; rather, it's the belief in human brokenness that shapes people's worldview. The script introduces the term 'anthro denialism' to describe the systemic denial of human worth in favor of elevating divine control. title: 5 Brain Traps That Kept You Believing & Hacks to Stay Sharp
description:
Get The Guide Here: https://wyndowshop.dldd.us/shopnow/index.php?rt=product/product&product_id=187
5 Brain Traps That Kept You Believing & Hacks to Stay Sharp

Your brain might be tricking you more than you think. In this episode, we delve into the six major cognitive traps‚Äîconfirmation bias, motivated reasoning, cognitive dissonance, availability heuristic, social proof, and negativity bias. Each of these biases can distort your thinking and lock you into a comfort zone that hampers personal growth, intellectual freedom, and integrity. Learn actionable hacks to spot, challenge, and overcome each trap, helping you build a life rooted in curiosity and evidence-based thinking instead of comfort and echo chambers. By recognizing and addressing these biases, you contribute to creating a society that values truth and integrity. Take the challenge today and start your journey to becoming a sharp, honest thinker.

In this thought-provoking episode, we delve into the unsettling central symbol of the Christian faith: the crucifixion. title: Why the Question 'Does God Exist?' Misses the Point
description:
Why the Question 'Does God Exist?' Misses the Point
Download the full Digital Study Guide for this episode and go deeper with insights, sources, and tools for reclaiming your mind and voice.
https://wyndowshop.dldd.us/shopnow/index.php?rt=product/product&product_id=178

This video explores the perennial question 'Does God exist?' and argues that it might be the wrong one to ask. It challenges the assumptions behind this question and scrutinizes the origins and utility of belief in deities, framing them as adaptive responses to fear and ignorance rather than divine truths. The discussion pivots to why we continue to seek divine existence and the implications of such beliefs on human behavior and society. Through a blend of psychology, history, and critical reasoning, this video encourages viewers to question the validity and impact of divine claims. Additionally, it offers insights into the process of deconstructing faith and reconstructing life with a sense of community and direction beyond traditional religious structures.

description:

Belief: The Cage or the Key? - Unpacking Religious Conditioning

In this episode, we delve into the profound question of whether belief is truly liberating or if it confines us. We explore how faith, when unexamined, can distort identity, hijack purpose, and delay healing. Examining religious conditioning, we discuss the inherited nature of belief and how it shapes our sense of self and our worldview. Unlearning these deep-seated beliefs and reclaiming our autonomy is emphasized as a journey of personal evolution. The video also addresses common myths around morality, atheism, and religious trauma, encouraging viewers to question safe but potentially limiting beliefs and to find their true selves beyond imposed doctrines. Join us in this thought-provoking conversation and learn how to reclaim your narrative and fuel your courage.

title: The Psychology of Christian Dishonesty: Why Truth Doesn‚Äôt Matter
description:
The Psychology of Christian Dishonesty: Why Truth Doesn‚Äôt Matter
Why do so many Christians refuse to truly investigate their beliefs?
It‚Äôs not malice. It‚Äôs not stupidity.
It‚Äôs survival.

In this powerful breakdown, we expose how Christianity ‚Äî for many ‚Äî has evolved into a system of identity protection rather than truth pursuit. From pulpits to prayer circles, belief is no longer about evidence; it's about preserving belonging, silencing doubt, and defending a crumbling social structure.

We unpack the psychology behind it all:

Identity-Protective Cognition: Why survival replaces curiosity

Evangelism as Coercion: Why honest questions are treated like betrayal

Sacred Canopy Collapse: Why investigating belief feels like social suicide

Social Dominance: How religion becomes a weapon to preserve power

This isn't about attacking individuals.
It's about exposing a systemic dishonesty designed to keep people trapped ‚Äî not seeking, but surviving.

If you‚Äôve ever felt gaslit by religious spaces, shamed for doubting, or attacked for asking honest questions ‚Äî this video will help you see what‚Äôs really happening beneath the surface.

Because truth doesn't need protection.
Fear does.

title: The Top 10 Lies I Told As A Pastor - And Didn't Even Realize It
description:
Check out my latest book! https://www.amazon.com/Black-Nonbeliever-Next-Door-X-Pastors-ebook/dp/B0DLDXV4ZL/ref=sr_1_3?crid=1XT4FX00F1M1F&dib=eyJ2IjoiMSJ9.e_EFNpIfI854rQFrTr0CvWWZbwgDHAMaI3EqV2WdSyJsYkHSf_O7d4saiX1bFeSWlcQ-cIgIN_9I-IrgUUQ6Nh5MQO7GEvmOu-0xhLWLxy4.6aZLwRU2p6ZAJjPKEJDuBSpWbDYSEMbM-wnce9ejrIQ&dib_tag=se&keywords=darante+lamar&qid=1739106718&sprefix=%2Caps%2C147&sr=8-3

The Top 10 Lies I Told As A Pastor
For years, I stood on the pulpit, preaching what I thought was the truth. I believed I was guiding people closer to God. But the reality? I was unknowingly spreading falsehoods, fear, and manipulation‚Äînot because I was deceptive, but because I was deceived.

In this video, I reveal the Top 10 Lies I Told as a Pastor‚Äîthe very doctrines that keep people trapped in Christianity without questioning it. These are the same lies your pastor tells you every Sunday, and chances are, he doesn‚Äôt even realize it.

0:00 - Introduction
1:41 - 10 God has a plan for your life
2:46 - 9 The Bible is the word of god
3:53 - 8 Jesus loves you unconditionally
4:24 - 7 Christianity is not a religion
5:13 - 6 Prayer Works
5:56 - 5 God answers in his own time
6:30 - 4 You can't be good without god
7:12 - 3 Doubt is a test of your faith
7:43 - 2 Hell is a choice
8:33 - 1 You have to have faith
8:59 - Conclusion

üìñ If you‚Äôve ever had doubts about your faith, this video is for you. If you‚Äôve been told to ‚Äújust have faith‚Äù whenever you asked hard questions, this video is for you. If you‚Äôve ever been taught to fear hell, obey blindly, and accept suffering as ‚ÄòGod‚Äôs plan‚Äô, this video is for you.

I was a pastor. I was deep in it. But I got out. And if you're watching this, you‚Äôre already on the path to freeing yourself from religious indoctrination.

title: Held Up By Misunderstanding // Christ Held Up
description:
Christ Held Up: What‚Äôs Taking So Long?

In "Christ Held Up: What‚Äôs Taking So Long?", Darante' LaMar takes readers on an intellectually stimulating journey through history and theology to explore one of Christianity‚Äôs most pressing questions: why has the anticipated return of Christ been delayed? With a blend of scholarly insight and conversational tone, Darante‚Äô delves into the complexities surrounding the Second Coming, examining historical contexts, theological nuances, and the differing expectations of various religious factions.
Through meticulous research and thoughtful analysis, LaMar challenges conventional interpretations and encourages readers to engage with the text critically. By highlighting the discrepancies between the Jewish Messiah and the Christian Christ, this book offers a fresh perspective on age-old beliefs. LaMar‚Äôs work is not about providing definitive answers but about inspiring a deeper quest for understanding and truth.
Whether you are a believer seeking clarity, a scholar interested in theological debates, or a curious reader looking for an enlightening read, "Christ Held Up" promises to enrich your understanding and provoke thoughtful reflection on the intricacies of faith and expectation.

Purchase Your Copy Here: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0D7NZ9B12/ref=sr_1_1?crid=3BLTNU0ODBJ8X&dib=eyJ2IjoiMSJ9.SJkbtOfhc2lU6c32lWfRCw.fnjIUJ8fUSpscTYDKaVKHMmMvTbW7pScqqvt3e3DJAo&dib_tag=se&keywords=Christ+Held+Up+Darante%27+LaMar&qid=1718973891&s=movies-tv&sprefix=christ+held+up+darante%27+lamar%2Cmovies-tv%2C290&sr=1-1
